creditline: Lent by The Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, Kansas City, Missouri, Gift of Sadajiro Yamanaka
description: tapered squat cylindrical body with square shoulder and wider rounded bottom; raised rim slightly flaired and rounded; ivory cover with circular bead and round knob at top; brown ground glaze splashed with dark reds, browns and yellows
medium:
Seto ware
Stoneware with iron glaze and ivory lid
text: The potter created a "splashed" impression on this tea caddy by trailing ash glaze across the surface. The resulting irregular pattern contrasts nicely with the precise workmanship of the jar. The overall form and sharp shoulder are strongly Chinese in style.
title: Tea caddy (chaire)
